channel.title: System on Songlin
channel.description: Recent content in System on Songlin

item.title: Clang: Don't Touch My Code!
item.description: Clang/LLVM is a toolchain that is widely adopted by both researchers and the industry. Based on LLVM, compilers for new targets are built, and program analysis solutions are developed, thanks to the well-defined LLVM IR. Nevertheless, Clang/LLVM is also famous for some of its strange (often just “different” from gcc) behaviors and very aggressive optimizations. Recently I am working on LLVM (7.0) for program analysis and instrumentation, and I think it’s time to write about how we are dealing with unwanted optimizations.
